English: How long have you been having difficulty breathing?
Spanish: ¿Cuánto tiempo has tenido dificultades para respirar?

English: Is it all the time, or only when you're doing something?
Spanish: ¿Es todo el tiempo o solo cuando estás haciendo algo?

English: Do you wake up at night not being able to breathe?
Spanish: ¿Te desperta por las noches no pudiendo respirar?

English: No, I don't think so.
Spanish: No, no pienso así.

English: Are you wheezing or coughing?
Spanish: ¿Estás silbando o tosiendo?

English: Are you coughing up mucus?
Spanish: ¿Estás tú expectando mucos?

English: Do you have fever or chills?
Spanish: ¿Tienes fiebre o escalofríos?

English: Sometimes chills.
Spanish: A veces me dan escalofríos.

English: Please sit on the exam table so that I can listen to your lungs.
Spanish: Por favor, siéntate en la mesa de exámenes para que pueda escuchar tus pulmones.

English: How long have you been sick?
Spanish: ¿Cuánto tiempo has estado enfermo?

English: Do your sinuses feel congested?
Spanish: ¿Sientes congestión en tus senos?

English: Are you getting mucus when you blow your nose?
Spanish: ¿Te estás produciendo mucos cuando te das un puntapié en la nariz?

English: Do you get a lot of sinus infections?
Spanish: ¿Frequently do you get sinus infections?

English: Yes, every winter.
Spanish: ¡Sí, todos los inviernos!

English: Have you had sinus surgery?
Spanish: ¿Has tenido cirugía de senos?

English: How long have you had the pain?
Spanish: ¿Cuánto tiempo has tenido el dolor?

English: Does the pain go down your arms?
Spanish: ¿El dolor baja por tus brazos?

English: What movement makes it worse?
Spanish: ¿Qué movimiento empeora más?

English: Have you had problems with your neck before?
Spanish: ¿Has tenido problemas con tu cuello antes?

English: Have you ever had neck surgery?
Spanish: ¿Has tenido alguna cirugía en la nuca?

English: I am going to examine your neck and test your reflexes.
Spanish: Voy a examinar tu cuello y probar tus reflejos.

English: How many days has your eye been red?
Spanish: ¿Cuántos días tiene tu ojo rojo?

English: Four days, doctor.
Spanish: Cuatro días, doctor.

English: Do you think you have something in your eye?
Spanish: ¿Crees que tienes algo en tu ojo?

English: Does the light bother your eyes?
Spanish: ¿La luz te bothers los ojos?

English: Maybe a little.
Spanish: Quizás un poco.

English: When was your last eye exam?
Spanish: ¿Cuándo fue tu última revisión de ojos?

English: I can't remember.
Spanish: No lo recuerdo.

English: Do you have glaucoma?
Spanish: ¿Tienes glaucoma?

English: I'm going to examine your eyes.
Spanish: Voy a examinar tus ojos.

English: How long has your knee been hurting you?
Spanish: ¿Cuánto tiempo te duele el rodilla?

English: Have you ever injured your knee?
Spanish: ¿Has nunca lesionado tu rodilla?

English: No, I don't think so.
Spanish: No, no pienso así.

English: Does your work require you to do a lot of kneeling?
Spanish: ¿Tu trabajo te requiere hacer muchas kness?

English: Yes, a lot.
Spanish: ¡Sí, mucho!

English: Does your knee ever give way or buckle when you walk?
Spanish: ¿Las rodillas te doblan o se desfuerzan cuando caminas?

English: Does your knee sometimes lock so that you cannot completely straighten your leg?
Spanish: ¿A times does your knee lock so that you can not fully extend your leg?

English: No, it just hurts.
Spanish: No, solo duele.

English: Does your knee feel stiff when you get up in the morning?
Spanish: ¿Sientes riguecimiento en tus rodillas al levantarte por la mañana?

English: Yes, it's worse in the morning.
Spanish: ¡Sí, es peor por la mañana!

English: I'm going to examine your knee while you are standing, sitting, and lying down.
Spanish: Voy a examinar tu rodilla mientras estés de pie, sentado y acostado.

English: Please point to where your head hurts.
Spanish: Por favor, apunta dónde duele la cabeza.

English: Here, on the side.
Spanish: Aquí, en el lado.

English: Do you wake up with the headache?
Spanish: ¿Te duele la cabeza al despertarte?

English: Does it get better or worse as the day goes on?
Spanish: ¿Mejorará o empeorará el día a medida que pase?

English: Probably a little better, but worse at night.
Spanish: probablemente un poco mejor pero peor por la noche.

English: How long have you had this headache?
Spanish: ¿Cuánto tiempo has tenido esta migraña?

English: Is it getting progressively worse?
Spanish: ¿Es que se va empeorando progresivamente?

English: Have you noticed any change in your vision?
Spanish: ¿Has notices cualquier cambio en tu visión?

English: I'm going to examine you head, eyes, ears, and neck.
Spanish: Voy a examinar tu cabeza, ojos, orejas y cuello.

English: How long have you had diarrhea?
Spanish: ¿Cuánto tiempo has tenido diarrea?

English: About a week.
Spanish: sobre una semana.

English: Two or three times every day. Maybe four times.
Spanish: Dos o tres veces al día. ¡Quizás cuatro!

English: Do you have any cramping?
Spanish: ¿Tienes dolores de piernas?

English: Yes, a little bit.
Spanish: ¡Sí, un poco!.

English: Sometimes. Yes, I think so.
Spanish: A veces. Sí, creo que sí.

English: Have you traveled recently?
Spanish: ¿Ha viajado recientemente?

English: Where did you go?
Spanish: ¿Dónde estuviste?

English: Please lie down on the exam table so I can examine your abdomen.
Spanish: Por favor, tú te recuestes en la mesa de exámenes para que pueda examinar tu abdomen.

English: Do your ears hurt?
Spanish: ¿Te duele los oídos?

English: Have you noticed any drainage?
Spanish: ¿Has notices any drainage?

English: Are you having difficulty hearing?
Spanish: ¿Tienes dificultades para oír?

English: A little bit.
Spanish: un poco.

English: Have you been swimming recently?
Spanish: ¿Has estado nadando recientemente?

English: On Wednesday.
Spanish: en miércoles

English: Please turn your head.
Spanish: Por favor, mueve tu cabeza.

English: I understand that your stomach has been hurting.
Spanish: Entiendo que tu estómago te duele.

English: Are there times when you are free of pain?
Spanish: ¿Hay momentos en los que estás libre de dolor?

English: Does eating make it worse?
Spanish: ¿Comer hace peor?

English: Are you burping or passing gas?
Spanish: ¿Estás borboteando o pasando gas?

English: I'm going to examine your abdomen.
Spanish: Voy a examinar tu abdomen.

English: How many days have you had your sore throat?
Spanish: ¿Cuántos días has tenido la garganta inflamada?

English: Is it getting better, worse, or staying the same?
Spanish: ¿Mejorando, empeorando o igual?

English: Have you ever had a strep infection?
Spanish: ¿Has tenido alguna infección por estreptocinia?

English: I don't think so.
Spanish: No, no creo.

English: Do you still have your tonsils?
Spanish: ¿Todavía tienes tus amígdalas?

English: No, doctor.
Spanish: No médico.

English: Open wide.
Spanish: Abranto.

English: Do you have to strain to have a bowel movement?
Spanish: ¿Te cuesta esfuerzo tener una evacuación bowel?

English: Is your stool hard?
Spanish: ¿Es tu estiolo duro?

English: Do you have hemorrhoids?
Spanish: ¿Tienes flemas?

English: I don't think so.
Spanish: No, no creo.

English: Have you seen any bright red blood?
Spanish: ¿Has visto alguna sangre roja brillante?

English: Yes, a little bit.
Spanish: ¡Sí, un poco!.

English: Is your stool maroon in color?
Spanish: ¿Tu banca es de morado en color?

English: Have you tried any over-the-counter treatments such as laxatives?
Spanish: ¿Has intentado algún tratamiento en la tienda como laxantes?

English: Was that helpful?
Spanish: ¿Fue útil?

English: Not really.
Spanish: No, no.

English: We're going to need a stool sample.
Spanish: Necesitamos una muestra de estíolo.

English: What are you going to do?
Spanish: ¿Qué vas a hacer?

English: First of all, we are going to do tests of blood and urine.
Spanish: En primer lugar, vamos a hacer pruebas de sangre y orina.

English: I was working on the roof of the building, and I fell!
Spanish: Estaba trabajando en el techo del edificio y me caí!

English: Did you hit your head? Did you lose consciousness?
Spanish: ¿Te golpeaste la cabeza? ¿Te perdiste el conocimiento?

English: No, neither of the two, but I think that I fractured my ankle!
Spanish: ¡No! Ni uno de los dos, pero creo que me fracturé la rodilla!

English: Yes, you have a fracture. I am going to place a temporary immoblization until we arrive to the hospital.
Spanish: ¡Sí, tienes una fractura! Voy a colocar una inmovilización temporal hasta que lleguemos al hospital.

English: Very well. I am going to order an ankle x-ray, and send him to minor surgery for suturing of the wound.
Spanish: ¡Muy bien! Voy a ordenar una radiografía de tobillo y enviarlo a la cirugía menor para la suturación de la herida.

English: Mrs. Bliss, can I to go to the nurse's office?
Spanish: ¿Señora Bliss, puedo ir al despacho de la enfermera?

English: Why? Today, We have an important exam.
Spanish: ¿Por qué hoy? ¡Tenemos un examen importante!

English: Well, suddenly, I have a terrible migraine.
Spanish: ¡Oh no! De repente, ¡me siento con un dolor de cabeza terribles!

English: How are you doing, Elizabeth? What brings you here?
Spanish: ¿Cómo estás, Elizabeth? ¿Por qué has venido aquí?

English: I am sorry, but the electrocardiogram shows that, possibly, you have hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.
Spanish: Lo siento, pero el electrocardiograma indica que, posiblemente, tienes miocarditis hipertrofica.

English: I understand, because my father has the same problem.
Spanish: Entiendo porque mi padre tiene el mismo problema.

English: We are going to request an echocardiogram.
Spanish: ¡Vamos a solicitar un ecocardiógrafo!

English: I suppose that the fact that I have no symptoms is good.
Spanish: Supongo que el hecho de no tener síntomas es bueno.

English: Look, Juan, your coach said that it is ok to miss a few days to be sure that your heart functions well. Don't worry.
Spanish: Mirar, Juan, tu entrenador dijo que es mejor perder algunos días para asegurarse de que funcione bien tu corazón. No te preocupes.

English: Good afternoon, doctor, how are you?
Spanish: ¡Buena tarde, doctor, ¿cómo estás?

English: Very good, Mrs. Ramírez. And what brings you here today?
Spanish: Muy bien, Señora Ramírez. ¿Y qué te trae hoy?

English: It is little Alejandro, doctor. He is complaining of having something in his eyes, and it even bothers him when he blinks.
Spanish: Es pequeño Alejandro, doctor. Le molesta algo en los ojos y incluso le bothers cuando se parpadea.

English: Ah! Let me see you Alejandro. Yes, now I see, and also your eyes have been tearing, isn't that right?
Spanish: ¡Ah! ¡Mira tú, Alejandro! ¡Sí, ahora veo y también tus ojos han llorado, ¿verdad?

English: Yes, doctor, it is like I am crying, they itch a lot, and in the mornings when I wake up, the eyes are stuck shut.
Spanish: ¡Sí, doctor, es como si llorara, me itchan mucho y en las mañanas cuando me levanto, los ojos están cerrados.

English: Doctor, is it something serious?
Spanish: ¿Doctor, ¿es algo serio?

English: Am I going to remain myself blind?
Spanish: ¿Me voy a quedar ciego por siempre?

English: Ay, thanks to God, doctor!. And what do we have to do?
Spanish: ¡Ay, gracias a Dios, médico! ¿Qué tenemos que hacer?

English: I am going to prescribe an antibiotic in drops. Two drops per day for 7 days will be sufficient. And, don't forget to wash the eyes carefully every morning, Alejandro.
Spanish: Va a prescribirme un antibiótico en gotas. Dos gotas al día por 7 días serán suficientes. Y no olvide lavear los ojos con cuidado cada mañana, Alejandro.

English: And has he had fever, or has he vomited?
Spanish: ¿Ha tenido fiebre o ha vomitado?

English: No, he has not vomited, but he had fever. The last fever was of 102 degrees.
Spanish: No ha vomitado, pero ha tenido fiebre. La fiebre más alta fue de 40 grados.

English: Have you given him some medicine for the diarrhea, or the fever?
Spanish: ¿Has le dado algún medicamento para la diarrea o la fiebre?

English: Yes, for the diarrhea. I gave him toasted rice water.
Spanish: ¿Qué traducción en español de la oración "Yes, for the diarrhea. I gave him toasted rice water."?

English: We will observe him first during a few hours. Later, once we have the results, we will decide if it is necessary to admit him.
Spanish: Lo observaremos por primera vez durante unas horas. Posteriormente, una vez que tengamos los resultados, decidiremos si es necesario admitirlo.

English: Mrs. Martinez, what are you doing here so soon? I thought that the well child check-up of the baby would be the next week...
Spanish: ¿Mrs. Martínez, ¿qué haces aquí tan temprano? Me figuraba que la revisión del niño saludable sería la próxima semana...

English: Yes, You are right, but it's that the girl hardly cries, and she is very irritable since last night. She rejects the breast, and doesn't eat since this morning after vomiting.
Spanish: Sí, tienes razón, pero es que la muchacha apenas llora y está muy irritada desde la noche pasada. Rechaza el pecho y no come desde esta mañana después de vomitar.

English: Has she had diarrhea or fever? Nurse, the girl has dry mucusal surfaces. Please hydrate her with intravenous physiologic solution.
Spanish: Has ella tenido diarrea o fiebre? Enfermera, la niña tiene superficies muco-cistosas secas. Por favor, hidrata con solución fisiológica intravenosa.

English: No, she has not had diarrhea, but fever, yes, two times, of 103 degrees, that don't go away completely with the medicine.
Spanish: No ha tenido diarrea, pero sí ha tenido fiebre, dos veces de 103 grados, que no se desvanecen completamente con la medicina.

English: Nurse, prepare equipment for lumbar puncture. We will have to rule out meningitis.
Spanish: Enfermera, prepara equipo para puncura lumbar. Necesitamos establecer un diagnóstico de meningitis.

English: We will have to take liquid from the spine. We will use a special needle and local anesthesia. Don't worry. It will not hurt her.
Spanish: Le hararemos una punción en la columna vertebral. Utilizaremos una aguja especial y anestesia local. No te preocupes, no le causará dolor.

English: And after that?
Spanish: ¿Y después de eso?

English: We will send the sample to the laboratory, to have a precise diagnosis.
Spanish: Le enviamos el muestreo al laboratorio para un diagnóstico preciso.

English: Help me doctor! My daughter's belly hurts her so much and she does not stop crying.
Spanish: ¡Médico, ayuda! Mi hija está tan dolorido en el vientre y no para llorar.

English: She is pallid. When was your last period, Rosana?
Spanish: ¿Cuándo fue la última menstruación, Rosana?

English: Just now it is present since this morning, with many clots, and it hurts me a lot. Help me, please!
Spanish: ¡Justo ahora está presente desde esta mañana con muchos coágulos y me duele mucho! ¡Ayúdame por favor!

English: Doctor! But she is only fourteen years old. She does not go out with anybody, she is still too young for that.
Spanish: ¿Doctor? ¡Pero ella solo tiene catorce años! No sale con nadie, todavía es demasiado joven para eso.

English: Doctor, it hurts me a lot!
Spanish: ¡Doctor, me duele mucho!

English: Nurse, come with me to do a gynecological exam. And include a pregnancy test in the laboratory orders.
Spanish: Enfermera, ¿vienes conmigo para hacer un examen ginecológico? Y incluye una prueba de embarazo en las órdenes del laboratorio.

English: Sir, I have to inform you that your daughter is on the way to the operating room. She is having a miscarriage.
Spanish: Señor, debo informarle que su hija se encuentra en camino al quirófico y está sufriendo un aborto.

English: I bring to you Ricardo, because he has not had a bowel movement for five days.
Spanish: Te traigo a Ricardo porque no ha tenido una evacuación intestinal en cinco días.

English: Is he eating normally?
Spanish: ¿Come de manera normal?

English: Not now. Initially, he was eating all his food, but yesterday his appetite began to diminish. Now, he only wants to drink liquids, and when I touch his belly, he complains.
Spanish: No ahora. Al principio, estaba comiendo todo su comida, pero hace un día que su apetito empezó a disminuir. Ahora solo quiere beber líquidos y cuando le toco su estómago, se queja.

English: I understand. In reality, he looks a bit distended. Has he had anything else, like vomiting or fever?
Spanish: Entiendo. En realidad, parece un poco inflado. ¿Ha tenido algo más, como vomitos o fiebre?

English: This morning he burped, and threw up part of the milk that he had drunk. I took his temperature, but he did not have a fever.
Spanish: This morning he burped, and threw up part of the milk that he had drunk. I took his temperature, but he did not have a fever.

English: Some little children can have intestinal obstruction, which begins with those symptoms. I am going to request an abdominal xray to guide us in the diagnosis.
Spanish: Algunos niños pequeños pueden tener una obstrucción intestinal, que comienza con estos síntomas. Va a solicitar una radiografía abdominal para ayudarnos en el diagnóstico.

English: Doctor, do you have my son's results now?
Spanish: ¿Doctor, ¿tienes los resultados de mi hijo ahora?

English: Yes. The radiograph shows that it is only a case of severe constipation. We are going to give him an enema. Afterwords, you will take him home, and you are going to give him a mild laxative for a few days, to help him to regulate the bowel movements.
Spanish: Sí. La radiografía muestra que solo es un caso de constipación severa. Le vamos a darle una enema. Luego, se llevará a casa y le dará un laxante suave durante unos días para ayudarle a regular sus movimientos intestinales.

English: Doctor, my daughter is here because she has very irregular periods. Sometimes it comes every month, then 2 or 3 months go by without it coming.
Spanish: ¿Doctor, mi hija está aquí porque tiene periods muy irregulares? A veces viene cada mes, y luego pasan dos o tres meses sin venir.

English: How long ago is it that she had her first menstruation? Has it always been irregular like that?
Spanish: ¿Cuánto tiempo hace de su primera regla? ¿Ha sido siempre así?

English: Two years ago I began with my periods. At first, it normally came every month, but 8 months ago it began to be irregular.
Spanish: 2 años atrás empecé con mis períodos. Al principio venía cada mes, pero hace 8 meses que empezó a ser irregular.

English: Have you gained weight recently?
Spanish: Has gainado peso recientemente?

English: Well, in reality, yes. In these last months, I have gained 5 pounds.
Spanish: ¿En realidad, sí? En estos últimos meses, he ganado 5 libras.

English: Which seems strange to me, because she is eating the same amount.
Spanish: ¿Qué parece extraño a mí, porque está comiendo la misma cantidad.

English: So that's why I have these changes?
Spanish: ¿Por qué tengo estas cambios?

English: Don't worry. Once the diagnosis is made, I will prescribe for you treatment by means of hormones, which will regulate periods for you, and will improve your skin condition.
Spanish: No te preocupes. Una vez que se hace el diagnóstico, te recetaré tratamiento con hormonas, que regularizarán tus periodos y mejorarán tu condición cutánea.

English: Hello!
Spanish: ¡Hola!

English: Mrs. Velásquez?
Spanish: Señora Velásquez?

English: Yes, it is I. Who is calling?
Spanish: ¡Sí soy yo! ¿Quién llama?

English: I am Dr. Pérez. I want to speak with you about the results of the laboratory tests that we did on Manuel last week, when he came for his routine check up.
Spanish: ¡Soy el Dr. Pérez! Quiero hablar contigo sobre los resultados de las pruebas de laboratorio que hicimos a Manuel la semana pasada, cuando vino por su revisión rutinaria.

English: Why? Is there something wrong?
Spanish: ¿Por qué? ¿Hay algo malo?

English: Anemia? But isn't that when the children are pallid and weak?
Spanish: ¿Anemia? ¡No, es cuando los niños son pálidos y débiles!

English: What is happening with Manuel is that his condition is moderate. Therefore he does not have symptoms.
Spanish: Lo que está sucediendo con Manuel es que su condición es moderada. Por lo tanto, no tiene síntomas.

English: But then if it is moderate and he does not have symptoms, why does he need medicine?
Spanish: Pero si es moderado y no tiene síntomas, ¿por qué necesita medicina?

English: To avoid problems with his mental development. The red blood cells of Manuel are small and pallid, and the levels of iron are low.
Spanish: Para evitar problemas en el desarrollo mental de Manuel. Las células rojas de Manuel son pequeñas y pálidas, y los niveles de hierro están bajos.

English: Problems with development? But he is already two years old, and he is growing so well...
Spanish: ¿Problemas con el desarrollo? ¡Pero ya tiene dos años y crece tan bien!

English: Yes, but if the iron deficiency persists, he can have learning difficlties when he is in school. Does he drink a lot of milk?
Spanish: ¡Sí! Pero si la deficiencia de hierro persiste, puede tener dificultades para aprender en la escuela. ¿Le gusta el leche?

English: Yes, of course, the only thing that he drinks is milk, all the time, and he eats quite a bit of bread, fruits, beans...
Spanish: ¡Sí, por supuesto! El único cosa que bebe es leche, todo el tiempo, y come bastante frutas, judías...

English: Oh, doctor, that, yes, is difficult. He doesn't like any kind of meat
Spanish: ¡Oh, doctor! ¡Eh, sí, es difícil! No le gusta ningún tipo de carne.

English: Well, that is the explanation of the problem. I am going to prescribe iron for him. What is the name and telephone number of your pharmacy?
Spanish: ¡Bueno! Eso es la explicación del problema. Voy a recetar hierro para él. ¿Cuál es el nombre y el número de teléfono de tu farmacia?

English: Good. Additionally, when you feed him, try to give him more meat and green vegatables, and less milk. Return here in two months to do the tests again. Agreed?
Spanish: ¡Buen! Además, cuando le des la comida, trata de darle más carne y vegetales verdes, y menos leche. Regresa aquí en dos meses para hacer los exámenes nuevamente. ¿Estás de acuerdo?

English: Yes, doctor, thanks for calling me.
Spanish: ¡Doctor, gracias por llamarme!

English: Why didn't this inhaler work last night when I was having trouble breathing?
Spanish: ¿Por qué no funcionó esta inhalador noche pasada cuando estaba teniendo dificultades para respirar?

English: That medicine is an inhaled steroid, and doesn't work like albuterol does for respiratory emergencies. Alfredo, there are two components of asthma, airway hyperractivity, and chronic inflammation.
Spanish: La medicina es un esteroide inhalado y no funciona como el albuterol en emergencias respiratorias. Alfredo, hay dos componentes de la asma, la hiperactividad bronquial y la inflamación crónica.

English: When someone with asthma is exposed, for example, to an allergen, virus, or change in climate, the airways may contract, or squeeze, making air movement difficult. That is hyperreactivity.
Spanish: When someone with asthma is exposed, for example, to an allergen, virus, or change in climate, the airways may contract, or squeeze, making air movement difficult. That is hyperreactivity.

English: On the other hand, chronic underlying inflammation within the lining of the airways is the other component of asthma. To diminish this factor, the inhaled steroid is used daily throughout the year. It is a gradual process.
Spanish: Por otro lado, la inflamación crónica subyacente en la limpieza de las vías respiratorias es el otro componente del asma. Para mitigar este factor, se utiliza el steróide inhalado diariamente durante todo el año. Es un proceso gradual.

English: And when you have shortness of breath, the albuterol inhaler works quickly to dilate and open the airways.
Spanish: Y cuando tienes dificultad para respirar, el inhalador de albuterol funciona rápidamente para dilatar y abrir las vías respiratorias.

English: Why do I have to brush my teeth after using the steroid inhaler?
Spanish: ¿Por qué tengo que cepillar mis dientes después de usar el inhalador de esteroides?

English: It is the same medicine, and when the inhaler is used properly, it has the same effect as the nebulizer machine with mask and tubing.
Spanish: Es el mismo medicamento y, al usarlo correctamente, tiene el mismo efecto que la nebulizadora con mascarilla y tubos.

English: Remember that with the albuterol inhaler, you first must exhale completely. Then while you breathe in slowly and deeply, depress the canister, inhale as much as possible, and hold your breath for ten seconds.
Spanish: Recorda que con el inhalador de albuterol, primero debes exhalar por completo. Luego, mientras respires lentamente y profundamente, presiona el canistro y inhala lo más posible durante diez segundos.

English: What is this medicine that I have to take orally for five days? Is it an antibiotic?
Spanish: ¿Qué medicamento es este que debo tomar por vía oral durante cinco días? ¿Es un antibiótico?

English: No, it is an oral steroid. It is a powerful anti-inflammatory medicine to help you overcome the asthma exacerbation. For the next two days, you will have to use the albuterol frequently, every four hours.
Spanish: No es una steróide oral. Es un medicamento antiinflamatorio poderoso para ayudarte a superar la exacerbación del asma. Por los próximos dos días, tendrás que usar el albuterol con frecuencia, cada cuatro horas.

English: Omar is a year old, and he is a very healthy boy. His weight and size are normal, but we need to talk about something important.
Spanish: Omar tiene un año y es un niño muy saludable. Su peso y tamaño son normales, pero necesitamos hablar de algo importante.

English: Oh doctor, don't scare us! He eats very well.
Spanish: ¡Oh doctor, no nos asustees! Come muy bien.

English: Yes, I know. It is about something else that I want to talk to you. When I examined Omar, I noticed that the left testicle is not in the scrotum.
Spanish: Sí, lo sé. Se trata de otra cosa que quiero hablar contigo. Cuando examiné a Omar, noté que el testículo izquierdo no está en la escrota.

English: What? And so then where is it?
Spanish: ¿Y así entonces dónde está?

English: For the moment, we must do a study to see if he was in effect born with the left testicle. It is probably hidden higher up in his body. Once it is localized, it will be necessary to operate.
Spanish: Por el momento, debemos hacer un estudio para ver si nació con el testículo izquierdo. Probablemente está escondido más alto en su cuerpo. Una vez que se haya localizado, será necesario operar.

English: And is it necessary to do it? Will he be a normal man when he grows up?
Spanish: ¿Es necesario hacerlo? Será un hombre normal cuando crezca?

English: Yes. It is necessary. If the testicles do not descend at birth, or during the first year, it is important to do the surgery, to place them down in the scrotum. It is the only way that they will be able to function normally in the future.
Spanish: Sí. Es necesario. Si los testículos no bajan en el nacimiento o durante el primer año, es importante hacer la cirugía para colocarlos en el escroto. Solo de esta manera podrán funcionar correctamente en el futuro.

English: Can something else happen if the testicle never lowers into the scrotum?
Spanish: ¿Puede algo más suceder si el testículo nunca baja al escroto?

English: And what do we have to do now?
Spanish: ¿Y ahora qué es lo que tenemos que hacer?

English: Yes, we will place the epidural anesthesia, but first we are going to lay you down on the bed.
Spanish: ¡Sí, vamos a colocar la anestesia epidural, pero primero vamos a tenderte en la cama.

English: Lie down in a fetal position. We are going to clean the lower area of your back. Later, you are going to feel a pinch in the spine, but when that happens, please, do not move.
I feel like something is going toward my legs.
Spanish: Me siento como si algo se está dirigiendo hacia mis piernas.

English: Now we are going to confirm the pain block. I am touching you with a little needle. Do you feel pain in any area of the legs where I have been touching?
Spanish: ¡Confirmamos el bloqueo de dolor! Estoy tocando con una aguja muy ligeramente. ¿Sientes dolor en alguna área de las piernas donde estoy tocando?

English: No, I do not feel anything, and I cannot move them!
Spanish: No siento nada y no puedo moverme!

English: Don't worry, that is normal. We will help you to position yourself on your back, in position for the birth. You are not going to have pain, but you are going to feel a kind of pressure when the baby begins to push.
Spanish: No te preocupes, es normal. Te ayudaremos a posicionarte en tu dorso para el parto. No vas a tener dolor, pero vas a sentir un tipo de presión cuando el bebé comience a empujar.

English: Yes, I am feeling it. I have to push.
Spanish: ¡Sí, lo estoy sintiendo! Tengo que empujar.

English: Okay. Take a deep breath. Hold it, and push! Very good. Again!
Spanish: ¡Okay! ¡Junté la respiración! ¡Reténla y empíeza!"

English: Continue Mrs. Dugarte, push! Very good, now rest, and let's wait for the next contraction.
Spanish: Continúa, señora Dugarte, empuje muy bien. ¡Muy bien!, ahora descansa y esperemos el siguiente contracción.

English: Here comes the contraction. Push hard. Hold it. One, two, three, four, five...
Spanish: Aquí viene la contracción. Empuja fuerte. Manténlo. Uno, dos, tres, cuatro, cinco...

English: Come on, my beautiful, only a little more!
Spanish: ¡Vamos, mi bella, solo un poco más!

English: Now, you are almost ready. You cannot stop now. Here comes the contraction. Come on, push!
Spanish: ¡Ya estás listo! No puedes parar ahora. Aquí viene la contracción. Vamos, empuje!

English: Now I can see the hair and part of the head. Very good, rest until the next contraction. Nurse, give me the scissors for the episiotomy.
Spanish: Ahora puedo ver el cabello y parte de la cabeza. Muy bien, descansar hasta la siguiente contracción. Enfermera, ¡dame las tijeras para la episiotomía!

English: Now I can see him. Go on, my sweetheart, you can!
Spanish: ¡Ahora puedo verlo! ¡Adelante, mi amor!, ¿puedes!

English: In the next contraction the doctor is going to make a little cut to help the baby come out. Here comes the contraction. Push one more time!
Spanish: En la próxima contracción el médico va a hacer un pequeño corto para ayudar al bebé a salir. Aquí viene la contracción. Empuja una más vez!

English: Perfect, head out. Very good, stop, do not push anymore! The baby is coming out. Here he is, it is a boy! Congratulations mom!
Spanish: ¡Perfecto! ¡Salea la cabeza! Muy bien, para ya, no empujes más! ¡El bebé sale! ¡Es un chico! ¡Felicidades, mamá!

English: Fantastic, he is very beautiful!
Spanish: ¡Fantástico! ¡Es muy guapo!

English: Is my baby okay?
Spanish: ¿Mi bebé está bien?

English: Don't you hear how he cries? He is perfect. They are cleaning him, and they are going to show him to you. Ahh, here he comes now... Dad brings him. What is his name going to be?
Spanish: ¿No escuchas cómo llora? ¡Es perfecto! ¡Van limpiándolo y van a presentarlo contigo! Ahí vieneee... ¡El padre se lo lleva! ¿Qué le van a llamar?

English: His name is Luciano. Luciano, I introduce you to your mom.
Spanish: Su nombre es Luciano. Luciano, te presento a tu madre.

English: Welcome to the world little son, I am your mom.
Spanish: ‟Bienvenido al mundo, pequeño hijo, soy tu madre”.

English: My daughter has a cough with a lot of phlegm.
Spanish: Mi hija tiene una tos con mucha flema.

English: Does she also have a fever?
Spanish: ¿También tiene fiebre?

English: Yes, she has a high fever, and the mucus is greenish.
Spanish: Sí, tiene una fiebre alta y la mucosidad es verdeácida.

English: Is she eating well?
Spanish: ¿Come ella bien?

English: She only wants liquids and she is somnolent.
Spanish: Ella solo quiere líquidos y está somnolenta.

English: I hear some noises characteristic of pneumonia, here in the lower part of the right lung.
Spanish: Escucho algunos ruidos característicos de la neumonía aquí en la parte inferior del pulmón derecho.

English: Be calm, first we will request x-rays and laboratory tests. Later we will decide.
Ok, I wait for the results.
Spanish: ¡Ok, esperaré los resultados!
